document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Yuan, Feng, Ascher, John S., Kasparek, Max, Orr, Michael C., Griswold, Terry & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.docTitle: Anthidium (Anthidium) pseudophilorum Niu & Yuan & Ascher & Kasparek & Orr & Griswold & Zhu 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

heading.emphasis:
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) pseudophilorum Niu & Zhu
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Fig. 21 a–j, male; Fig. 22 a–f, female)

Diagnosis : Males of this species differ from all other Chinese
Anthidium
except
A. cingulatum
by the submedian spines on T7. From
A. cingulatum
it can be separated by the long median spine of T7 which extends posteriorly as far as the submedian spines. It shares with
A. philorum
Cockerell, 1910
in both sexes the black indentations anteriorly on their yellow tergal bands; female T6 of
A. philorum Cockerell, 1910
has preapical lateral projection ( Fig. 18f ), lateral margin of male S6 is straight and slanting (
Fig. 19g
), male T7 is without submedian spine ( Fig. 19f ). In contrast, the species’ female T6 lacks a preapical lateral projection ( Fig. 22f ), apical margin of male S6 is deeply emarginated, with distinct lateral lobe, and median lobe is bilobed ( Fig. 21f ), male T7 is with submedian spine ( Fig. 21e ), and the median spine of T7 is nearly as long as the submedian spine ( Fig. 21e ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 21.
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) pseudophilorum Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.
. Male. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Mesosoma in dorsal view; d: Metasoma in dorsal view; e: T6–T7 in dorsal view; f: S6 in ventral view; g: S7 in ventral view; h: S8 in ventral view; i: Genitalia in dorsal view; j: Genitalia in lateral view. Scale bars: 1 mm.

FIGURE 22.
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) pseudophilorum Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.
. Female. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Clypeus in frontal view; d: Mesosoma in dorsal view; e: Metasoma in dorsal view; f: T4–T6 in dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm.

A. ( A. ) philorum Cockerell, 1910
.
